OptionChoice.name: enableRailCraft
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle RailCraft ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle RailCraft ores.
RailCraft ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpRailCraft
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of RailCraft ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up RailCraft ores.
RailCraft ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

OptionChoice.name: rlcrAbyssalOresDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Abyssal Ores is generated

Choice.Description: Multi-layered deposit in a spherical shape.

Choice.description: Abyssal Ores is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: rlcrAbyssalOresFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for RailCraft Abyssal Ores distributions

OptionNumeric.name: rlcrAbyssalOresSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for RailCraft Abyssal Ores distributions

OptionChoice.name: rlcrPoorIronDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Poor Iron is generated

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Poor Iron is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: rlcrPoorIronFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for RailCraft Poor Iron distributions

OptionNumeric.name: rlcrPoorIronSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for RailCraft Poor Iron distributions

Substitute.name: rlcrOverworldBlockSubstitute4
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Substitute.name: rlcrOverworldBlockSubstitute6
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: rlcrAbyssalOresGeodeShell
Veins.Description: Multi-layered deposit. On the outside is a shell, usually made of some form of stone. Within this shell is sprinkled ores. Inside both is an air pocket from which the enterprising miner can look for the contained ores.

Veins.name: rlcrAbyssalOresGeodeOre
Veins.Description: Multi-layered deposit. On the outside is a shell, usually made of some form of stone. Within this shell is sprinkled ores. Inside both is an air pocket from which the enterprising miner can look for the contained ores.

Veins.name: rlcrAbyssalOresGeodeBubble
Veins.Description: Multi-layered deposit. On the outside is a shell, usually made of some form of stone. Within this shell is sprinkled ores. Inside both is an air pocket from which the enterprising miner can look for the contained ores.

Veins.name: rlcrPoorIronVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.

Cloud.name: rlcrPoorIronCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: rlcrPoorIronHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: rlcrPoorIronStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.
